title: Venezuelan Migrants Stranded After US Border Policy Change
description: They have sold their belongings and trekked across a deadly jungle. Now, tens of thousands Venezuelan migrants are stranded south of the United States, with nowhere to go.
dc:creator: David Shortell and Julie Turkewitz
media:credit: Alejandro Cegarra for The New York Times
media:description: Venezuelan migrants on a hill near the border with United States in Ciudad Juárez, Mexico. The United States has started turning back many Venezuelans reaching the border.
